properties.Title: Wall painting of a banquet
properties.Desc_text:
Roman, 1st century
CE. Fresco, 59 × 53 cm (23 1/4 ×
20 7/8 in.). From Herculaneum
(Italy). Museo Archeologico Nazionale
di Napoli, Naples, 9024.

properties.Title: Mosaic depicting the drinking contest between Herakles and Dionysos
properties.Desc_title: Mosaic depicting the drinking contest between Herakles and Dionysos
properties.Desc_text:
Roman, 2nd century CE.
Marble, limestone, and glass
tesserae, 183.5 × 186.4 × 7.6 cm
(72 1/4 × 73 3/8 × 2 7/8 in.). From the
Atrium House at Antioch-on-the-
Orontes (Turkey). Worcester Art
Museum, Massachusetts, Excavation
of Antioch and Its Vicinity
Funded by the Bequests of Reverend
Dr. Austin S. Garver and
Sarah C. Garver, 1933.36.

properties.Title: Statuette of a Lar holding a rhyton with the forepart of a goat
properties.Desc_title: Statuette of a Lar holding a rhyton with the forepart of a goat
properties.Desc_text:
Roman, 1st–2nd century CE. Bronze, 24.8 ×
11.6 × 5.4 cm (9 3/4 × 4 9/16 × 2 1/8 in.).
Metropolitan Museum of Art,
New York, Rogers Fund, 1919,
19.192.3.

properties.Title: Statuette of a Lar holding a rhyton with the forepart of a dolphin
properties.Desc_title: Statuette of a Lar holding a rhyton with the forepart of a dolphin
properties.Desc_text:
Roman, early
1st century CE. Bronze, height:
10.2 cm (4 in.). Metropolitan
Museum of Art, New York, Rogers
Fund, 1919, 19.192.50.
properties.Credit: © The Metropolitan Museum of Art. Image source: Art Resource, NY

properties.Title: Rhyton with the Forepart of a Horse
properties.Desc_title: Rhyton with the forepart of a horse
properties.Desc_text:
Roman,
1st century BCE–1st century CE.
Glazed terracotta, 12 × 9 cm
(4 3/4 × 3 9/16 in.). Walters Art
Museum, Baltimore, Acquired
by Henry Walters, 48.127.

properties.Title: Footed rhyton with horned head
properties.Desc_text:
Roman, 1st–2nd century
CE. Glass, height: 16.5 cm
(6 1/2 in.); diameter: 11.4 cm
(4 1/2 in.). The British Museum,
London, Bequest of James Woodhouse,
1868,0110.510.
properties.Credit: © The Trustees of the British Museum. All rights reserved

properties.Title: Rhyton forepart in the form of a centaur
properties.Desc_title: Rhyton forepart in the form of a centaur
properties.Desc_text:
Hellenistic, c. 160 BCE.
Silver, partially gilded, height:
22 cm (8 11/16 in.); weight: 689 g.
From Falerii Novi (Cività Castellana,
Italy). Kunsthistorisches
Museum, Vienna, VIIa 49.

properties.Title: Rhyton with the forepart of a wild cat
properties.Desc_title: Rhyton with the forepart of a wild cat
properties.Desc_text:
Parthian,
1st century BCE. Silver,
partially gilded, height: 27.5 cm
(10 7/8 in.); weight: 519.7 g. Metropolitan
Museum of Art, New
York, Purchase, Rogers Fund;
Enid A. Haupt, Mrs. Donald M.
Oenslager, Mrs. Muriel Palitz,
and Geert C. E. Prins Gifts; Pauline
V. Fullerton Bequest; and
Bequests of Mary Cushing Fosburgh,
Edward C. Moore, and
Stephen Whitney Phoenix, by
exchange, 1979, 1979.447.
properties.Credit: © The Metropolitan Museum of Art. Image source: Art Resource, NY

properties.Title: Rhyton with the forepart of a zebu bull
properties.Desc_title: Rhyton with the forepart of a zebu bull
properties.Desc_text:
Seleucid
or Parthian, 2nd century BCE.
Silver, partially gilded, height:
29.2 cm (11 1/2 in.); diameter: 14.2
cm (5 9/16 in.); weight: 1,140.9 g.
Toledo Museum of Art, Ohio,
Purchased with funds from
the Libbey Endowment, Gift
of Edward Drummond Libbey,
1988.23.
properties.Credit: Courtesy of the Toledo Museum of Art

properties.Title: Rhyton with the Forepart of a Stag
properties.Desc_title: Rhyton with the forepart of a stag
properties.Desc_text:
Parthian,
1st century BCE–1st century CE.
Silver, partially gilded, height:
27.4 cm (10 13/16 in.); diameter:
12.6 cm (4 15/16 in.); weight: 899.6 g.
J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles,
86.AM.753.
properties.Credit: Digital image courtesy of the Getty's Open Content Program

properties.Title: Door jamb with relief decoration
properties.Desc_text:
Gandharan,
3rd century CE. Schist, 124 ×
38.4 × 10.2 cm (48 13/16 × 15 1/8 ×
4 in.). Museum of Fine Arts,
Boston, Charles Amos Cummings
Fund, 39.36.

properties.Title: Rhyton with a centaur holding a goat
properties.Desc_title: Rhyton with a centaur holding a goat
properties.Desc_text:
Perhaps
Saka, late 1st millennium
BCE. Bronze and copper, height:
27.5 cm (10 13/16 in.); diameter: 16.4
cm (67/16 in.). From Gilgit (Pakistan).
Ashmolean Museum of Art
and Archaeology, University of
Oxford, EA1963.28.
